conversation.content: [disoriented] Wait, you're not with them, you're not one of the people who've been keeping me here for the past six days in this basement?
[calmly] I've been with them for three weeks actually, building trust, learning their routines, waiting for the right moment to get you out safely without anyone getting hurt.
You're lying.
Your wife's maiden name is Harrison, your daughter just turned seven last month, and you have a scar on your left shoulder from a skiing accident in Aspen. [pause] Your company hired me.
[shocked whisper] They hired you to, what, infiltrate these people? But they told me the company wouldn't pay, that they'd abandoned me completely.
That's what we needed them to believe, because paying ransoms just creates more kidnappings, but leaving you here wasn't an option either. [quietly] I specialize in extractions.
[bitter laugh] So I've been sitting here for six days thinking my own company considered me expendable, and the whole time you were, what, playing revolutionary upstairs?
[firmly] Playing revolutionary well enough that they trust me to bring you food, which means in about four minutes, you and I walk out that door together, nice and calm.
Just like that? We just walk out and they won't notice their hostage is suddenly gone? [incredulous] That's your master plan?
They're all watching the news upstairs because I made sure a certain story about government raids would break right about, [checks watch], now actually, which gives us a twelve-minute window.
[urgently] But my face has been all over their propaganda videos, they've sent my picture to every cell in the network, so how do we get past—
You're going out as my cousin Miguel who's been hiding in the basement workshop, and trust me, with this beard I've been growing you and these clothes, [sighs], nobody's looking twice.
Miguel doesn't speak English.
[quickly] Which is why you're going to keep your mouth shut and let me do all the talking while we walk three blocks to a van that's been parked there for two days.
This is insane.
Insane is sitting in this basement waiting for a government raid that'll end with bullets, so unless you have a better option, we need to move right now. [measured]
[standing up shakily] God, I can barely walk straight after being chained to this pipe, but yeah, okay, let's do this before I lose my nerve completely.
Lean on me like you're drunk, it'll explain the stumbling and give us a reason to leave early, plus it keeps your face turned away from anyone we pass. [exhales] Ready?
[determined whisper] My daughter's birthday party is next weekend, and I swore I'd make it home for that, so yeah, I'm ready to trust whatever crazy plan you've got.
[triumphant whisper] Then let's go give her the best present she could ask for—her parent walking through that door when she never thought she'd see you again. [pause] Time to move.
